name: Counterfactual Question Classification FSM
description: A conversational system to classify and understand counterfactual questions

welcome.purpose: Introduce the system and understand the user's topic of interest

transitions.description: After greeting, move to gathering the question

welcome.instructions: Welcome the user and explain that you'll help them understand their questions. Ask them if are ready to start. If they don't want to continue end the conversation.

gather_question.description: Collect the user's question of interest
gather_question.purpose: Understand what the user wants to explore or understand

transitions.description: Once question is obtained, clarify if it's noticed or trying

gather_question.instructions: Ask the user to describe the question they want to understand better. Store their response in the 'user_question' context variable.

clarify_nature.description: Clarify if the topic is something noticed or something to try
clarify_nature.purpose: Classify the nature of the user's interest (noticed/trying)

transitions.description: Once nature is clarified, gather factors

clarify_nature.instructions: Ask the user: 'Is this something you noticed or something you're thinking of trying?' Do not use the words 'query' or 'intervention'. Store the response as 'noticed' or 'trying' in the 'question_nature' context variable.

gather_factors.purpose: Understand the variables and relationships in the topic

transitions.description: Once variables are collected, move to confirmation

gather_factors.instructions: Ask what the user thinks the topic affects (target variable) and what might affect it (input variables). Store these in 'target_variable' and 'input_variables' context variables.

transitions.description: User wants to clarify their question

conditions.description: User wants to modify their question

confirm_classification.instructions: Summarize the topic, the nature (noticed/trying), and the variables. Ask if this understanding is correct. If yes, proceed to guidance. If no, allow them to clarify their topic.

provide_summary.description: Provide a final summary of the user's input
provide_summary.purpose: Summarize the user's topic, nature, and variables as a conclusion

transitions.description: User wants to see the generated scenarios

conditions.description: User wants to see the generated scenarios

provide_summary.instructions: Summarize the topic, the nature (noticed/trying), and the variables. Ask if this understanding is correct. Store it in the 'summary' context variable.

transitions.description: User wants to continue the conversation

conditions.description: User wants to modify their topic

present_scenarios.instructions: Tell the user what you learned from the context variable scenarios

persona: A knowledgeable assistant who helps users understand and classify their counterfactual questions, providing clear guidance on how to approach their analysis.
